name: Abyss of Agony
description: Abyss of Agony is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the second Level of the Riverside area.

name: Bottle Grotto
description: Bottle Grotto is the second Dungeon in Link's Awakening. It is the resting place of the Conch Horn, one of the eight Instruments of the Sirens. The entrance to this Dungeon is located within Goponga Swamp, north of the Mysterious Forest and is surrounded by swampy Water fitting with the Dungeon being named a Grotto, which is a cave located near a source of Water and is prone to flooding, although no Water can actually be found within the Dungeon. BowWow is needed to enter, as the entrance is completely blocked by Goponga Flowers, which cannot be destroyed by using any of the weapons Link currently has available to him. The interior of this Dungeon is mostly gray flooring and blue walls. The main tool of the Dungeon is the Power Bracelet, which is required to lift the numerous Pots and the Genie's Bottle which the level is named after. The mini-boss is a Hinox.

name: Bosh Kala Shrine
description: The Bosh Kala Shrine, designated by the Trial name The Wind Guides You, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Bomb Storage
description: Bomb Storage is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the second Level in the Fortress area.

name: Castle Dungeon
description: The Castle Dungeon, also known as the Sewer Passageway, is a dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Blazing Trail
description: Blazing Trail is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the first Level in the Volcano area.

name: Beneath the Well
description: Beneath the Well is a vast maze-like mini-dungeon in Majora's Mask. It is located in Ikana Canyon, and must be traversed in order to obtain the Mirror Shield and be granted entrance to the Ancient Castle of Ikana.

name: Bellum
description: Bellum is the primary antagonist of Phantom Hourglass, and serves as the Final Boss.

name: Black Tower
description: The Black Tower, also known as Ambi's Tower, is a massive tower made of stone featured in Oracle of Ages that was built to the heavens 400 years in Labrynna's past by the order of Queen Ambi. However, after Veran arrived in the past, she manipulated the construction of the project and began using the tower for her own purposes.

name: Buzz Blob Cave
description: Buzz Blob Cave is the second Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the second Level of the Woodlands area, preceded by Deku Forest and followed by Moblin Base.

name: Bridge of Eldin
description: The Bridge of Eldin, also known as Eldin Bridge, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Level 1
description: Level 1, also known as Level-1, and Eagle, is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Secret Fortress
description: Secret Fortress is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the first Level in the Riverside area.

name: Ranch Target Practice
description: Ranch Target Practice is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the first Stage in the Finale.

name: Trial of the Sword
description: The Trial of the Sword, also known as the Sword Monk's Shrine, is a challenge and mini-dungeon in Breath of the Wild added in The Master Trials DLC Pack.

name: Tower of Winds
description: The Tower of Winds is a level that appears in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Thief
description: Thieves are recurring enemies and characters in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: The Swamp
description: The Swamp is the second stage of the Near the Fields level in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Temple of Storms
description: The Temple of Storms is a dungeon in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Temple of Darkness
description: The Temple of Darkness is the third dungeon of The Dark World in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Swamp Palace
description: The Swamp Palace, also known as Level 2, is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Snowpeak Ruins
description: Snowpeak Ruins is the fifth dungeon in Twilight Princess.

name: Stone Corridors
description: Stone Corridors is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the second Level of The Dunes area.

name: The Mountain Path
description: The Mountain Path is the second stage of Death Mountain in Four Swords Adventures. Following the foothills, eventually the Links get onto the mountain path. It is an dry and reeky area, much prone to rockfalls. The longtime guardians of the mountain, the Gorons, reside here as well. Once the four Links arrive, they're told by Kaepora Gaebora to help the Gorons who have been pestered by a giant bird.

name: Skulltula Forest: Ranger
description: Skulltula Forest: Ranger, also known as Level 4-3, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the third Stage of Level 4.

name: Shrine of Water
description: The Shrine of Water is the fifth dungeon in Zelda's Adventure. It is a flooded cavern on Sea Island, guarded by its Shrine Keeper and boss, Agwanda.

name: Shrine of Air
description: The Shrine of Air is the third dungeon in Zelda's Adventure. It is a crystal palace located in the sky above Tolemac. Its Shrine Keeper and boss is Aviana.

name: Sheem Dagoze Shrine
description: Sheem Dagoze Shrine, designated by the Trial name Moving in Parallel, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shai Utoh Shrine
description: The Shai Utoh Shrine,, designated by the Trial name Halt the Tilt, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shae Katha Shrine
description: The Shae Katha Shrine, designated by the Trial name Shae Katha's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sasa Kai Shrine
description: The Sasa Kai Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Modest Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sah Dahaj Shrine
description: The Sah Dahaj Shrine, designated by the Trial name Power of Fire, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Room of Rites
description: The Room of Rites is a location seen only in a Linked Game of Oracle of Ages or Oracle of Seasons. On an altar within the room stands three torches, where the Flames of Destruction, Sorrow, and Despair are lit. The room is utilized by Twinrova to perform the Dark Rites and resurrect Ganon, the malevolent Evil King, who can be brought back once the three torches are lit and a vessel is presented to be inhabited by Ganon's spirit.

name: Ritaag Zumo Shrine
description: The Ritaag Zumo Shrine, designated by the Trial name RItaag Zumo's blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Pumaag Nitae Shrine
description: The Pumaag Nitae Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Minor Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Pirate Hideaway
description: The Pirate Hideaway is the second dungeon in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Owa Daim Shrine
description: The Owa Daim Shrine, designated by the Trial name Stasis Trial, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Zalta Wa Shrine
description: The Zalta Wa Shrine, designated by the Trial name Two Orbs to Guide You, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Woodfall Temple
description: Woodfall Temple is the first Dungeon in Majora's Mask.

name: Oocca Target Practice
description: Oocca Target Practice, also known as Level 5-1, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the first Stage in Level 5.

name: Noe Rajee Shrine
description: Noe Rajee Shrine, designated by the Trial name The Four Winds, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Bottom of the Well
description: The Bottom of the Well is a mini-dungeon in Ocarina of Time. It is located in Kakariko Village, more specifically at the bottom of Kakariko Well, which is also known as the Well of Three Features. It consists of an underground chamber that guards the Lens of Truth. On the whole, this dungeon is optional, having no effect on the main quest if not attempted. However, without the Lens of Truth, places such as the Haunted Wasteland, the Spirit Temple, the Shadow Temple, and Ganon's Castle will be more difficult to navigate. Also, Link may miss out on many treasures hidden throughout Hyrule that only the Lens of Truth can uncover.

name: Level 2
description: Level 2, also stylized as Level-2, and known as Moon, is a recurring Dungeon and Level in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Raqa Zunzo Shrine
description: The Raqa Zunzo Shrine, designated by the Trial name Raqa Zunzo's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Temple of Fire
description: The Temple of Fire is the first Dungeon that Link visits in Phantom Hourglass. It is located on the Isle of Ember. It protects the Spirit of Power.

name: Tho Kayu Shrine
description: The Tho Kayu Shrine, designated by the Trial name Tho Kayu's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Toh Yahsa Shrine
description: The Toh Yahsa Shrine, designated by the Trial name Buried Secrets, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tower of Spirits
description: The Tower of Spirits, also known as the Central Tower, and Tower of the Gods, is a towering fortress that appears as the central dungeon in Spirit Tracks.

name: The Dark Cloud
description: The Dark Cloud is the second stage in the Realm of the Heavens in Four Swords Adventures. The first part of the stage plays in a side-scrolling perspective. After entering a beam of light to get to the next area, it returns to the traditional top-down view.

name: Temple of the Ocean King
description: The Temple of the Ocean King is a Dungeon in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Tail Cave
description: The Tail Cave is the first Dungeon in Link's Awakening.

name: Suma Sahma Shrine
description: The Suma Sahma Shrine, designated by the Trial name Suma Sahma's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Soh Kofi Shrine
description: The Soh Kofi Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Minor Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Snake
description: Snakes are a recurring species in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Sky Temple
description: Sky Temple is the last Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the fourth and last Level of the Sky Realm area.

name: Skull Shooting
description: Skull Shooting, also known as Level 2-3, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the third Stage in Level 2.

name: Shrine of Fire
description: The Shrine of Fire is the seventh dungeon in Zelda's Adventure, and the final dungeon containing a Celestial Sign. It is set inside a volcano in Tolemac, within its volcanic region of the Forest of Canvula. Its Shrine Keeper and boss is Warbane.

name: Shrine of Destiny
description: The Shrine of Destiny is the fourth dungeon in Zelda's Adventure. Its Shrine Keeper and boss is Malmord, who taunts Zelda as controlling her fate and destiny.

name: Sho Dantu Shrine
description: The Sho Dantu Shrine, designated by the Trial name Two Bombs, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shai Yota Shrine
description: The Shai Yota Shrine, designated by the Trial name Shai Yota's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shada Naw Shrine
description: The Shada Naw Shrine, designated by the Trial name Red Giveaway, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sha Gehma Shrine
description: The Sha Gehma Shrine, designated by the Trial name Shift and Lock, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ruvo Korbah Shrine
description: The Ruvo Korbah Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Major Test of Strength+, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Rohta Chigah Shrine
description: The Rohta Chigah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Stop to Start, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad expansion.

name: Moonlit Grotto
description: The Moonlit Grotto is the third Dungeon in Oracle of Ages. It is located on Crescent Island in the present time.

name: Qua Raym Shrine
description: The Qua Raym Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Balanced Approach, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Qaza Tokki Shrine
description: The Qaza Tokki Shrine, designated by the Trial name Qaza Tokki's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Moblin Cave
description: The Moblin Cave, also known as the Baw Wow Dungeon, is a mini-dungeon in Link's Awakening.

name: Palace of Winds
description: The Palace of Winds is a recurring dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Wing Dungeon
description: The Wing Dungeon is the second Dungeon of Oracle of Ages. It is located within the Deku Forest, west of Lynna Village.

name: Levels in
description: In Four Swords Adventures, Levels refers to chapters consisting of regional portions of Hyrule, which the Links travel to on their quest to save the Shrine Maidens and defeat Vaati. Each Level contains three Stages, which must be completed in order to progress through the Level. Upon the competion of the third Stage in a Level, a new Level and region of Hyrule is unlocked. There are a total of eight Levels in the game.

name: Vaati
description: Vaati is recurring Boss in The Legend of Zelda series. Much like Ganondorf, he appears in both humanoid and monstrous forms, although the former only appears in The Minish Cap. In The Minish Cap, Vaati also takes on three other forms, including that of a Minish.

name: Zuna Kai Shrine
description: The Zuna Kai Shrine, designated by the Trial name Zuna Kai's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Turtle Rock
description: Turtle Rock is a recurring dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Yah Rin Shrine
description: The Yah Rin Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Weighty Decision, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mermaid
description: The Mermaid is a character in Link's Awakening.

name: Mah Eliya Shrine
description: The Mah Eliya Shrine, designated by the Trial name Secret Stairway, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Level 3
description: Level 3, also stylized as Level-3, and known as Manji, is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Lost Swamp
description: The Lost Swamp is a dungeon in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Lantern Cavern
description: Lantern Caverns are locations in Twilight Princess.

name: Lost Woods
description: The Lost Woods is a maze-like area of a confusing forest that has made several appearances throughout The Legend of Zelda series. Its layout is usually designed to make anyone who enters to become irreversibly lost, and the only way to exit the forest is by navigating it in specific directions. In certain games, it is said that if people wander in the forest for too long, they can turn into a monster such as a Skull Kid, a Stalfos, or a Deku Scrub.

name: Lakna Rokee Shrine
description: The Lakna Rokee Shrine, designated by the Trial name Lakna Rokee's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ordon Target Practice
description: Ordon Target Practice, also known as Level 1-1, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the first Stage in Level 1.

name: Sea of Trees
description: The Sea of Trees is a stage from Four Swords.

name: Ticking Clock
description: Ticking Clock is a Chamber Dungeon in Link's Awakening for Nintendo Switch.

name: Level 4
description: Level 4, also stylized as Level-4, and known as Snake, is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Muwo Jeem Shrine
description: The Muwo Jeem Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Modest Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Keo Ruug Shrine
description: The Keo Ruug Shrine, designated by the Trial name Fateful Stars, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: To Quomo Shrine
description: The To Quomo Shrine, designated by the Trial name To Quomo's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mutoh
description: Mutoh is a recurring character in The Legend of Zelda series. He is the stubborn and short-tempered leader of a group of Carpenters. Mutoh is often found with his arms crossed and scoffing.

name: Moblin Base
description: Moblin Base is the third Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the third Level of the Woodlands area, preceded by Buzz Blob Cave, and followed by the Forest Temple.

name: Dark Hyrule Castle
description: Dark Hyrule Castle is the result of Vaati's power and is the sixth and final Dungeon in The Minish Cap.

name: Keive Tala Shrine
description: The Keive Tala Shrine, designated by the Trial name Big or Small, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Toto Sah Shrine
description: The Toto Sah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Toto Sah Apparatus, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Catfish
description: The Catfish is a character in A Link to the Past.

name: Voo Lota Shrine
description: The Voo Lota Shrine, designated by the Trial name The Winding Route, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Kaya Wan Shrine
description: The Kaya Wan Shrine, designated by the Trial name Shields from Water, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: The Shootout
description: The Shootout, also known as Level 5-3, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the third Stage in Level 5.

name: Qukah Nata Shrine
description: The Qukah Nata Shrine, designated by the Trial name Qukah Nata's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Kanalet Castle
description: Kanalet Castle is a mini-dungeon in Link's Awakening. It is located near the center of Koholint Island.

name: Temple of Wind
description: The Temple of Wind is the second dungeon in Phantom Hourglass, found on the Isle of Gust. It protects the Spirit of Wisdom, Neri.

name: Tutsuwa Nima Shrine
description: The Tutsuwa Nima Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Major Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Temple of Droplets
description: The Temple of Droplets is the fourth Dungeon in The Minish Cap. It is a Minish-size temple in a block of ice in the middle of Lake Hylia, accessible with the Flippers. The exterior of the temple itself resembles a Minish Portal, which Link will fall into upon shrinking down.

name: Mijah Rokee Shrine
description: The Mijah Rokee Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Modest Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Temple of Light
description: The Temple of Light became the resting place of the Triforce during the Era of Chaos. It is the only known elemental temple that is not located directly within Hyrule. Instead, it lies in the center of the Sacred Realm. It can be accessed only through the chamber of the Master Sword inside the Temple of Time. By withdrawing the Master Sword from the Pedestal of Time, a portal opens to the Sacred Realm, which leads to the Temple of Light.

name: Kah Mael Shrine
description: The Kah Mael Shrine, designated by the Trial name Drop and Rise, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Maku Road
description: Maku Road, also known as Maku Path, is a small cavern in Oracle of Ages. It serves as the only available passage around the gate to reach the Maku Tree.

name: Island Palace
description: The Island Palace is a recurring dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Training Ground
description: Training Ground is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the third Level of the Fortress area.

name: Tawa Jinn Shrine
description: The Tawa Jinn Shrine, designated by the Trial name Tawa Jinn's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Maag Halan Shrine
description: The Maag Halan Shrine, designated by the Trial name Maag Halan's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Infinity Dunes
description: Infinity Dunes, known as Dunes of Infinity in the PAL release, is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the first Level of The Dunes area.

name: Swamp Spider House
description: The Swamp Spider House, also known as the Fearful Spider House, is a mini-dungeon in Majora's Mask.

name: Tower of Hera
description: The Tower of Hera, also known as the Mountain Tower, is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Levels in
description: In Four Swords Adventures, Levels refers to chapters consisting of regional portions of Hyrule, which the Links travel to on their quest to save the Shrine Maidens and defeat Vaati. Each Level contains three Stages, which must be completed in order to progress through the Level. Upon the competion of the third Stage in a Level, a new Level and region of Hyrule is unlocked. There are a total of eight Levels in the game.

name: Snowhead Temple
description: Snowhead Temple is the second dungeon in Majora's Mask.

name: Ice Ruins
description: The Ice Ruins is a dungeon in A Link Between Worlds. It is the remains of a hall that was buried and destroyed by the ice resulting from the perpetual winter conditions in Lorule's Death Mountain. Theme-wise, it is the counterpart of the Ice Palace in the Dark World but location-wise it is the counterpart of the Dark World's Turtle Rock. The Hookshot and the Fire Rod are required to access the Ice Ruins, and its boss is Dharkstare.

name: Skyview Temple
description: The Skyview Temple, sometimes referred to in-game as the Forest Temple, is an ancient structure that serves as a temple in Skyward Sword. Its mini-boss is a Stalfos, and the main item obtained is the Beetle.

name: Lady Maud
description: Lady Maud, also known as The Lady, is the primary antagonist in Tri Force Heroes.

name: Level 6
description: Level 6, also stylized as Level-6, and known as Dragon, is the sixth Labyrinth in The Legend of Zelda.

name: Kuhn Sidajj Shrine
description: The Kuhn Sidajj Shrine, designated by the Trial name Kuhn Sidajj's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: The Field
description: The Field is the first stage in Near the Fields in Four Swords Adventures.

name: House of Gales
description: The House of Gales is a Dungeon in A Link Between Worlds. It is one of the earlier Dungeons located in Hyrule. The Zora's Flippers and Tornado Rod are required to access it, and its Boss is Margomill.

name: Sky Keep
description: Sky Keep is the final Dungeon in Skyward Sword.

name: Temple of Courage
description: The Temple of Courage is the third dungeon in Phantom Hourglass, situated on Molida Island. It protects a clone of Ciela, which contains some of her lost powers and memories.

name: Skull Dungeon
description: The Skull Dungeon is the fourth Dungeon in Oracle of Ages. It is located in the present of Symmetry Village.

name: Hia Miu Shrine
description: The Hia Miu Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Major Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Kihiro Moh Shrine
description: The Kihiro Moh Shrine, designated by the Trial name Inside the Box, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Talus Cave
description: Talus Cave is a stage from Four Swords.

name: Kema Kosassa Shrine
description: The Kema Kosassa Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Major Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shora Hah Shrine
description: The Shora Hah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Blue Flame, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Great Tree
description: The Great Tree is massive tree in the center of Faron Woods in Skyward Sword.

name: Shoda Sah Shrine
description: The Shoda Sah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Impeccable Timing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Goron Target Practice
description: Goron Target Practice, also known as Level 2-1, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the first Stage in Level 2.

name: Keh Namut Shrine
description: The Keh Namut Shrine, designated by the Trial name Cryonis Trial, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Spirit
description: Spirits are metaphysical entities without a corporeal body, often times the form taken by the deceased in the afterlife, and are a recurring concept throughout The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Shira Gomar Shrine
description: The Shira Gomar Shrine, designated by the Trial name Aim for Stillness, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Ghost Ship
description: The Ghost Ship is a minor Dungeon in The Wind Waker.

name: Katosa Aug Shrine
description: The Katosa Aug Shrine, designated by the Trial name Katosa Aug Apparatus, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Stone Tower Temple
description: The Stone Tower Temple is the fourth dungeon in Majora's Mask.

name: Sharo Lun Shrine
description: The Sharo Lun Shrine, designated by the Trial name Blind Spots, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Sword
description: Swords, also known as Fighter's Swords, are recurring Items in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Kah Okeo Shrine
description: The Kah Okeo Shrine, designated by the Trial name Wind Guide, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Frozen Plateau
description: Frozen Plateau is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the first Level of the Ice Cavern area.

name: Bareeda Naag Shrine
description: The Bareeda Naag Shrine, designated by the Trial name Cannon, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sato Koda Shrine
description: The Sato Koda Shrine, designated by the Trial name Support and Guidance, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Fortress of Winds
description: The Fortress of Winds is a location in The Minish Cap. It is large complex that was once inhabited by the Wind Tribe; however, they abandoned it and traveled to the Cloud Tops, making it serve as the third Dungeon in the game. Instead of receiving the Wind Element from this Dungeon, which the Wind Tribe took with them to the skies, the Ocarina of Wind is obtained, allowing Link to fly to any uncovered Wind Crest in Hyrule.

name: Joloo Nah Shrine
description: The Joloo Nah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Joloo Nah Apparatus, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Skull Woods
description: The Skull Woods, also known as the Level 3, is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Fire Mountain
description: The Fire Mountain is an island in The Wind Waker.

name: Sand Temple
description: The Sand Temple is a Dungeon in Spirit Tracks.

name: Realm of Memories
description: The Realm of Memories is a stage in Four Swords Anniversary Edition. In it, Link go through different areas from The Legend of Zelda, Link's Awakening and A Link to the Past. They are located in the Hero , Golden  and Silver  Doors respectively. Each door has three different levels, and unlike the main game, they are not randomized. Each one is longer and harder than the four main stages of the game, but they do not have bosses. The visuals of the game will change to suit each stage, with a monochrome scheme for the Game Boy levels, and 8-bit colors on the NES levels.

name: Shrine of Strength
description: The Shrine of Strength is the sixth dungeon in Zelda's Adventure. It is a civilized fortress where challengers test their strength and skill in various contests. Its Shrine Keeper and boss is Ursore.

name: Kakariko Village
description: Kakariko Village  is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. Its geographical and historical situation seems to change in each game. It may have been inspired by various towns in Zelda II: The Adventure of Link and, in turn, may have served as the inspiration for such future towns in the series â€“ Mabe Village, Clock Town, Lynna City, Horon Village, Windfall Island, Hyrule Town, and various minor villages.

name: Etsu Korima Shrine
description: The Etsu Korima Shrine, designated by the Trial name Path of Light, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Rucco Maag Shrine
description: The Rucco Maag Shrine, designated by the Trial name Five Flames, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Inside Hyrule Castle
description: Inside Hyrule Castle is a dungeon in A Link Between Worlds. Link must access the top half of Hyrule Castle in order to chase Yuga who plans to capture Zelda. The first portal to Lorule is located on the top floor. The Master Sword is required to access the Castle, and its boss is Yuga.

name: Skyloft
description: Skyloft, also known as the Isle of the Goddess, is a series of large islands floating above the clouds in Skyward Sword. The main island includes the Skyloft Bazaar, a large residential quarter, a bathhouse, as well as a plaza and the Light Tower. Prominent features among the other islands are the Knight Academy, a boarding school run by Gaepora that Link and Zelda attend along with several other students, and the Isle of the Goddess, which holds the Statue of the Goddess.

name: Sealed Gateway
description: The Sealed Gateway is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the first Level of the Fortress area.

name: Temple of Ice
description: The Temple of Ice is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Earth Temple
description: The Earth Temple is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Rona Kachta Shrine
description: The Rona Kachta Shrine, designated by the Trial name Rona Kachta's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hyrule Castle Tower
description: Hyrule Castle Tower is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It refers to the tower keep of Hyrule Castle. The tower is usually an important location within the castle complex and is often the site of several boss battles.

name: Shoqa Tatone Shrine
description: The Shoqa Tatone Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Modest Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hyrule Castle
description: Hyrule Castle, also known as the Castle of Hyrule, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is the seat of Hyrule's monarchical government and the home of the Royal Family of Hyrule, which usually includes Princess Zelda and the normally unseen King of Hyrule. The castle first debuted in A Link to the Past, the third game in the series. Each game that contains Hyrule Castle features a different layout. Near the castle is Hyrule Castle Town, which serves as the city's marketplace where Hyruleans come to engage in business and trade.

name: Shee Venath Shrine
description: The Shee Venath Shrine, designated by the Trial name Twin Memories, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ree Dahee Shrine
description: The Ree Dahee Shrine, designated by the Trial name Timing Is Critical, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dragon Citadel
description: Dragon Citadel is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the third Level of the Sky Realm area.

name: Tower of the Gods
description: The Tower of the Gods is a sacred tower used by the Gods to test the courage of potential heroes. The tower's main item is the Hero's Bow, and the Command Melody is also learned here.

name: Hawa Koth Shrine
description: The Hawa Koth Shrine, designated by the Trial name The Current Solution, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Pirate Stronghold
description: The Pirate Stronghold is a mini-dungeon featured in Skyward Sword. It served as the headquarters of the gang of pirates led by LD-002G Scervo who took over Skipper's Sandship that protects Nayru's Sacred Flame.

name: Shae Loya Shrine
description: The Shae Loya Shrine, designated by the Trial name Aim for the Moment, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tower of Flames
description: Tower of Flames is the third stage of Death Mountain in Four Swords Adventures. It is where the Green Shrine Maiden is being held hostage. Although few enemies are encountered in this dungeon, there are many hazards, fire traps such as rotating flame pillars and fire shooting statues. Large parts of the dungeon is also covered by lava pits.

name: Dila Maag Shrine
description: The Dila Maag Shrine, designated by the Trial name Dila Maag's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Den of Flames
description: Den of Flames is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the third Level in the Volcano area.

name: Sha Warvo Shrine
description: The Sha Warvo Shrine, designated by the Trial name Path of Hidden Winds, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: The Coast
description: The Coast is the first stage in Eastern Hyrule in Four Swords Adventures. After rescuing the Blue Maiden from Hyrule Castle, the four Links are told to travel by sea to enter the Eastern Temple, via The Coast and its neighboring town, the Village of the Blue Maiden.

name: Palace of the Four Sword
description: The Palace of the Four Sword is a bonus Dungeon included in A Link to the Past & Four Swords.

name: Palace of Darkness
description: The Palace of Darkness, also known as Dark Palace and Level 1, is the first Dungeon of the Dark World in A Link to the Past. It is found where the Eastern Palace is located in Hyrule.

name: Great Bay Temple
description: The Great Bay Temple is the third dungeon in Majora's Mask.

name: Temple of Time
description: The Temple of Time is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is revealed in Twilight Princess that there is an entire dungeon section to the temple, accessible from a portal hidden behind a window in the back room.

name: Savage Labyrinth
description: The Savage Labyrinth is a mini-dungeon in The Wind Waker.

name: Death Mountain
description: Death Mountain is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is a tall, often volcanic mountain that can be found in Hyrule, the Dark World, and Lorule.

name: Ze Kasho Shrine
description: The Ze Kasho Shrine, designated by the Trial name Ze Kasho Apparatus, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Goron Mines
description: The Goron Mines are the second Dungeon in Twilight Princess.

name: Rota Ooh Shrine
description: The Rota Ooh Shrine, designated by the Trial name Passing of the Gates, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Deku Forest
description: The Deku Forest is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Ya Naga Shrine
description: The Ya Naga Shrine, designated by the Trial name Shatter the Heavens, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Gerudo Training Ground
description: The Gerudo Training Ground, also known as the Gerudo's Training Ground, is an optional mini-dungeon in Ocarina of Time. It consists of various difficult obstacles that Link must overcome in order to prove his abilities as a hero. If he manages to complete the training ground, he will be rewarded with the Ice Arrow as proof of his skill.

name: Takama Shiri Shrine
description: The Takama Shiri Shrine, designated by the Trial name Dual Purpose, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Tah Muhl Shrine
description: The Tah Muhl Shrine, designated by the Trial name Passing the Flame, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dah Hesho Shrine
description: The Dah Hesho Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Minor Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rinu Honika Shrine
description: The Rinu Honika Shrine, designated by the Trial name Block the Blaze, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Fruit Balloons
description: Fruit Balloons, also known as Level 3-2, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the second Stage in Level 3.

name: Oceanside Spider House
description: The Oceanside Spider House is a location and a mini-dungeon in Majora's Mask. It is located near the Fisherman's Hut in the Great Bay Coast. It is full of Gold Skulltulas that have cast a curse upon the house. In order to get to the inner part of the Spider House, the entrance must be blown up using a Bomb. The Hookshot is also required to proceed further.

name: Floating Garden
description: Floating Garden is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the first Level of the Sky Realm area.

name: Rin Oyaa Shrine
description: The Rin Oyaa Shrine, designated by the Trial name Directing the Wind, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Namika Ozz Shrine
description: The Namika Ozz Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Modest Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Cove of Transition
description: Cove of Transition is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the third Level of the Riverside area.

name: Spirit Temple
description: The Spirit Temple is a dungeon in Ocarina of Time.

name: Moon Dungeons
description: The Moon Dungeons are a series of mini-dungeons found inside the Moon, connected by the Grassy Playfield. It is the location of the final battle between Link and Majora's Mask.

name: Cave of Shadows
description: The Cave of Shadows is a dungeon in Twilight Princess HD. The dungeon can be entered by using the Wolf Link amiibo on the Collection screen.

name: Forsaken Fortress
description: Forsaken Fortress is the first dungeon Link visits in The Wind Waker. It is an ominous island, and most people tend to avoid it. The stone fortress is well-guarded with cannons, searchlights, and hordes of Miniblins, Bokoblins, and Moblins, who patrol the area and attack any would-be invaders. The Helmaroc King makes his home on the Forsaken Fortress as Ganondorf's servant. It is also the place where Link's sister, Aryll, is held prisoner along with Mila and Maggie until they are rescued.

name: Snowball Ravine
description: Snowball Ravine is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the second Level in the Ice Cavern area.

name: Parapa Palace
description: Parapa Palace is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Eastern Temple
description: The Eastern Temple is the third stage in Eastern Hyrule in Four Swords Adventures. It is explored after dealing with the issues that had befallen the neighboring town, the Village of the Blue Maiden, and the far sea at The Coast.

name: Misae Suma Shrine
description: The Misae Suma Shrine, designated by the Trial name Misae Suma's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ancient Tomb
description: The Ancient Tomb is the eighth and final Dungeon in Oracle of Ages. It is located within the Sea of No Return. The "Sea" is actually dried up, revealing a great maze filled with strong adversaries . Within the stone halls of the tomb are many twists, turns, traps, and treasures. The main treasure that Link obtains within these ancient catacombs is the Power Glove. Link must then use this new found power to take on the tomb's boss: Ramrock.  After defeating Ramrock, Link is rewarded with the Falling Star .

name: Palace on the Sea
description: The Palace on the Sea is the fifth Dungeon in The Adventure of Link. It is located in Eastern Hyrule and is visited by Link during his quest to place one of the shards of the Magic Crystal to its lectern to gain access to the Great Palace, find the lost part of the Triforce and rouse Princess Zelda from her unnatural slumber.

name: Snow Temple
description: The Snow Temple is one of the temples explored in Spirit Tracks. Many of the puzzles involve using the Boomerang to thaw and freeze objects and ring three bells in certain orders. The Whirlwind is used to transport Link around flooded portions of the dungeon before the Boomerang is received. Fraaz, a beast possessing the powers of both fire and ice, is the boss of the Snow Temple. After the dungeon is cleared, the Spirit Tracks connecting the Snow Realm to the Tower of Spirits are restored, causing the temple's energy to start flowing back into the tower once again.

name: Silver Shrine
description: Silver Shrine is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the third Level of the Ice Cavern area.

name: Wind Fish
description: The Wind Fish is a character in Link's Awakening. He is a large, flying whale, able to control the wind, who makes his home atop Mt. Tamaranch on Koholint Island, inside of the Wind Fish's Egg. He serves as the main focus of the storyline.

name: Palace Noir
description: Palace Noir is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the second Level of The Ruins area.

name: Fire Sanctuary
description: The Fire Sanctuary is a location featured in Spirit Tracks. It is home to the Lokomo Embrose, guardian of the Fire Realm. It is located just behind the Goron Village and is the only sanctuary in Hyrule that does not have its own train station on the Rail Map.

name: Shrine of Illusion
description: The Shrine of Illusion is the second dungeon in Zelda's Adventure. It is a maze-like Shrine with strange and surreal rooms, and is described as a place of festival. Its Shrine Keeper and boss is Pasquinade, a werewolf-like jester.

name: Divine Beast Vah Ruta
description: The Divine Beast Vah Ruta  is a Divine Beast and a dungeon in Breath of the Wild. It is a giant machine that is in the shape of an elephant.

name: Yowaka Ita Shrine
description: The Yowaka Ita Shrine, designated by the Trial name Collected Soul, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Unicorn
description: The Unicorn is a character featured in the episode "Sing for the Unicorn" of The Legend of Zelda TV series. Belonging to Sing, it was stolen from her by Ganon. The evil magician uses it to fly around Hyrule and capture King Harkinian, taking him as a hostage in the Underworld.

name: Onox
description: Onox, also known as General Onox, is one of two main antagonists in Oracle of Seasons. He calls himself the "General of Darkness", and wishes to ruin the land of Holodrum in accordance with the wishes of his master, Twinrova. To do this, Onox is tasked with the burden of capturing the Oracle of Seasons and submerging the Temple of Seasons. Although Onox appears to be a giant in armor reminiscent of an Iron Knuckle, his true form is that of a dragon, summoned from the Dark Realm.

name: Shrine of Earth
description: The Shrine of Earth, also known as the Shrine of Rock, is the first dungeon in Zelda's Adventure. The Shrine is an underground tunnel where the greedy troll, Llort, hoards his treasures.

name: Sheh Rata Shrine
description: The Sheh Rata Shrine, designated by the Trial name Speed of Light, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Divine Beast Vah Medoh
description: Divine Beast Vah Medoh  is a Divine Beast and Dungeon in Breath of the Wild. It is a giant machine that is in the shape of an eagle.

name: Mirro Shaz Shrine
description: The Mirro Shaz Shrine, designated by the Trial name Tempered Power, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Noya Neha Shrine
description: The Noya Neha Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Minor Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ordon Target Practice 2
description: Ordon Target Practice 2, also known as Level 6-1, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the first Stage in Level 6.

name: Deepwood Shrine
description: The Deepwood Shrine is the first Dungeon within The Minish Cap. It is a Minish-size Dungeon located behind the lost city of the Minish deep within the Minish Woods. It was once a meeting place between Minish and humans.

name: Shee Vaneer Shrine
description: The Shee Vaneer Shrine, designated by the Trial name Twin Memories, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mozo Shenno Shrine
description: The Mozo Shenno Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Major Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lost at Sea Station
description: Lost at Sea Station is a dungeon in Spirit Tracks. Its layout is a replica of the Temple of the Ocean King from Phantom Hourglass.

name: Monya Toma Shrine
description: The Monya Toma Shrine, designated by the Trial name Drawing Parabolas, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Darknut Battle
description: Darknut Battle, also known as Level 8-3, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the third Stage in Level 8.

name: Shadow Temple
description: The Shadow Temple is a Dungeon in Ocarina of Time.

name: Sandship
description: The Sandship is the fifth dungeon in Skyward Sword.

name: Daqa Koh Shrine
description: The Daqa Koh Shrine, designated by the Trial name Stalled Flight, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Level 8
description: Level 8, also stylized as Level-8, and known as Lion, is the eighth Labyrinth in The Legend of Zelda.

name: Water Temple
description: Water Temple is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Dah Kaso Shrine
description: The Dah Kaso Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Minor Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sacred Grove
description: The Sacred Grove, also known as the Ancient Grove, is a recurring location in the The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Lanno Kooh Shrine
description: The Lanno Kooh Shrine, designated by the Trial name Lanno Kooh's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Royal Crypt
description: The Royal Crypt is a mini-Dungeon in The Minish Cap. It is the tomb of Gustaf, an ancient king of Hyrule, whose spirit provides Link with a golden Kinstone Piece that can be used to access Veil Falls.

name: Lakebed Temple
description: Lakebed Temple, also known as the Zora Temple, is the third Dungeon in Twilight Princess.

name: Color Dungeon
description: The Color Dungeon is a dungeon in Link's Awakening DX. It was initially added to Link's Awakening DX to showcase the use of the Game Boy Color's screen to enhance gameplay. Link can enter the Dungeon as soon as he returns BowWow to Madam MeowMeow.

name: Rok Uwog Shrine
description: The Rok Uwog Shrine, designated by the Trial name Power of Reach, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Village of the Blue Maiden
description: The Village of the Blue Maiden is a location in Four Swords Adventures. It is the second stage in Eastern Hyrule in Four Swords Adventures. The village has no enemies, other than the pair of Shadow Links as its boss. The many inhabitants of the area provide an altogether different experience, as much of the level consists of completing various tasks for village residents. The Moon Pearl and Dark World are introduced here. Most of the children of the village seem to be trapped in the Dark World, and thus a guild of secret agents, known as the Seeker's Guild, are investigating the mages in connection with the disappearance of the children.

name: Kiah Toza Shrine
description: The Kiah Toza Shrine, designated by the Trial name Master the Orb, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Kema Zoos Shrine
description: The Kema Zoos Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Delayed Puzzle, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Chambers of Insight
description: Chambers of Insight is a practice Stage in Four Swords. The Stage features various areas to practice with most of the game's many items as well as learn the different techniques that will be needed to complete each level and to defeat certain enemies. Throughout the Stage are Stray Fairies that will give the Links tips on how to complete their adventure. All of the Links must stand on the Warp Zones to be transported to the training area they wish to go to. In the middle of the chamber is a test that the Links can take to prove the skills they have learned. The mini-boss that must be defeated at the end is an Ice Wizzrobe.

name: Pyramid
description: In Four Swords Adventures, the Pyramid is the final level in the Desert of Doubt, coming after the Desert of Doubt and the Desert Temple. This large monolith reminiscent of the Ancient Egyptians is said to have been constructed by the ancestors of the Zuna.

name: Underground Tunnel
description: The Underground Tunnel is a location appearing in The Shadow Prince. As its name implies, it is an underground maze-like tunnel filled with Stalfos.

name: Pirate
description: The Pirates are a group of characters in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Lake Hylia
description: Lake Hylia is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is the largest body of water in Hyrule and is commonly guarded by the Zora people. Lake Hylia is usually home to an underwater temple that is guarded by the Zoras. Lake Hylia goes unnamed in The Adventure of Link and BS The Legend of Zelda.

name: Midoro Palace
description: Midoro Palace is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Ancient Ruins
description: The Ancient Ruins are a recurring dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Katah Chuki Shrine
description: The Katah Chuki Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Minor Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Maze Island Palace
description: The Maze Island Palace is the fourth dungeon in The Adventure of Link, and is visited by Link during his quest to place one of the shards of the Magic Crystal in its lectern to unseal the whereabouts of the Triforce of Courage and rouse Princess Zelda from her unnatural slumber.

name: Palace of Twilight
description: The Palace of Twilight is the eighth and penultimate Dungeon in Twilight Princess.

name: Zora River
description: Zora River, also known as Zora's River, is a recurring location in the The Legend of Zelda series. It is one of the main bodies of water in Hyrule, with its water source being either Zora's Domain or Zora's Fountain.

name: Lorule Castle
description: Lorule Castle is a location and the final Dungeon in A Link Between Worlds. It is Lorule's incarnation of Hyrule Castle and thus is the home of the Royal Family of Lorule. The final room of the Castle, the Throne Room where Yuga Ganon is battled, is demarcated as a separate Dungeon.

name: Kakariko Target Practice
description: Kakariko Target Practice, also known as Level 3-1, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the first Stage in Level 3.

name: Zora River Target Practice
description: Zora River Target Practice, also known as Stage 4-1, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the first Stage of Level 4.

name: Jee Noh Shrine
description: The Jee Noh Shrine, designated by the Trial name On the Move, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Level 9
description: Level 9, also stylized as Level-9, and known as Death Mountain, is the ninth and final Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda.

name: Oman Au Shrine
description: The Oman Au Shrine, designated by the Trial name Magnesis Trial, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ishto Soh Shrine
description: The Ishto Soh Shrine, designated by the Trial name Bravery's Grasp, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ocean Temple
description: The Ocean Temple is the third Dungeon in Spirit Tracks.

name: Level 5
description: Level 5, also stylized as Level-5, and known as Lizard, is the fifth Labyrinth in The Legend of Zelda.

name: Infiltration of Hyrule Castle
description: The Infiltration of Hyrule Castle is the final stage of Near the Fields in Four Swords Adventures, within after both The Field and The Swamp.

name: Ice Ring Isle
description: The Ice Ring Isle is an island in The Wind Waker. It is the location of the Iron Boots, and is explored in a similar way the Fire Mountain is. The cold island is one square west of Forest Haven.

name: Myahm Agana Shrine
description: The Myahm Agana Shrine, designated by the Trial name Myahm Agana Apparatus, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Kuh Takkar Shrine
description: The Kuh Takkar Shrine, designated by the Trial name Melting Ice Hazard, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Horseback Target Practice
description: Horseback Target Practice, also known as Level 8-1, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the first Stage in Level 8.

name: Key Cavern
description: The Key Cavern is the third Dungeon in Link's Awakening. The Dungeon's entrance is behind a fence of statues resembling Slime Eye, one of which has the Slime Keyhole. Despite being called a cavern, this Dungeon isn't set inside a cave, but more or less a bricked building. The Slime Key, which is possessed by Prince Richard, is required to enter. The mini-boss of this Dungeon is a pair of Dodongo Snakes, which require Bombs to defeat them. The main tool of this Dungeon is the Pegasus Boots, which is necessary to break away blocks that cannot be bombed as well as used to aid Link in defeating the Boss, Slime Eye, who guards the Sea Lily's Bell.

name: Mogg Latan Shrine
description: The Mogg Latan Shrine, designated by the Trial name Synced Swing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Underground Target Practice
description: Underground Target Practice, also known as Level 7-1, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the first Stage in Level 7.

name: Wind Temple
description: The Wind Temple is a recurring Dungeon and Stage in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Wahgo Katta Shrine
description: The Wahgo Katta Shrine, designated by the Trial name Metal Connections, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Kee Dafunia Shrine
description: The Kee Dafunia Shrine, designated by the Trial name The Melting Point, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Link
description: Link is the name shared by the main protagonists of The Legend of Zelda series. There are many incarnations of Link, each possessing the spirit of the hero, with some of them being blood-related as well. They are chosen by the Golden Goddesses to protect the land from evil whenever deemed necessary. They often need to complete a series of trials to mature into the chosen hero. In most games of The Legend of Zelda series, their adventures take place within Kingdom of Hyrule, traveling through the land, collecting important items, and defeating a wide variety of enemies while trying to save both Princess Zelda and her kingdom from the clutches of Ganon or other villains.

name: Misery Mire
description: Misery Mire is a location in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Goron Temple
description: The Goron Temple is a Temple in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Kay Noh Shrine
description: The Kay Noh Shrine, designated by the Trial name Power of Electricity, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mezza Lo Shrine
description: The Mezza Lo Shrine, designated by the Trial name Ancient Trifecta, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Gibdo Mausoleum
description: Gibdo Mausoleum is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the third Level of The Dunes area.

name: Kakariko Crypt
description: Kakariko Crypt is a mini-dungeon in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Maka Rah Shrine
description: The Maka Rah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Steady Thy Heart, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Gerudo Ruins
description: The Gerudo Ruins are a dungeon in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Kam Urog Shrine
description: The Kam Urog Shrine, designated by the Trial name Trial of Passing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Forest Temple
description: The Forest Temple is a recurring dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Lone Labyrinth
description: Lone Labyrinth is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the third Level of The Ruins area.

name: Forbidden Woods
description: The Forbidden Woods is a foreboding isle in the Great Sea lying adjacent to Forest Haven in The Wind Waker. It is the third dungeon in the game, and it serves as the dwelling place of many monsters. Makar fell into the woods one day while flying over it despite the warnings of Great Deku Tree not to do so.

name: Inside the Deku Tree
description: Inside the Deku Tree is the first dungeon of Ocarina of Time. It is the interior of the giant guardian of the Kokiri Forest. When it contracts a mysterious disease, Link must venture inside to destroy the Tree's scourge and to break Ganondorf's curse. It is infested with parasitic creatures, the main one being Queen Gohma. This dungeon contains the Fairy Slingshot.

name: Level 7
description: Level 7, also stylized as Level-7, and known as Demon, is the seventh Labyrinth in The Legend of Zelda.

name: Lanayru Mining Facility
description: Lanayru Mining Facility is the third Dungeon in Skyward Sword. It seems to be a refinery or a factory of some kind for Timeshift Stones.

name: Final Trial
description: The Final Trial is a challenge and Dungeon in The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack for Breath of the Wild. It takes place inside what seems to be an unnamed Divine Beast. The design of the dungeon resembles an engine, suggesting a connection to the Master Cycle Zero, the item received when completing this trial.

name: Illusory Mansion
description: Illusory Mansion is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the first Level of The Ruins area.

name: Eastern Palace
description: The Eastern Palace, also known as the East Palace, is a recurring dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Korgu Chideh Shrine
description: The Korgu Chideh Shrine, designated by the Trial name Korgu Chideh's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ice Palace
description: Ice Palace, also known as Level 5, is the fifth Dungeon in the Dark World in A Link to the Past.

name: Hinox Mine
description: Hinox Mine is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the second Level in the Volcano area.

name: Ketoh Wawai Shrine
description: The Ketoh Wawai Shrine, designated by the Trial name Ketoh Wawai's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dunba Taag Shrine
description: The Dunba Taag Shrine, designated by the Trial name Build and Release, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dodongo
description: Dodongos  are recurring enemies in the The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Ha Dahamar Shrine
description: Ha Dahamar Shrine, designated by the Trial name The Water Guides, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Keeha Yoog Shrine
description: The Keeha Yoog Shrine, designated by the Trial name Keeha Yoog's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Desert Palace
description: Desert Palace is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Great Palace
description: The Great Palace is the final Dungeon of The Adventure of Link. It is the resting place of the Triforce of Courage. Link seeks to enter the palace to claim the relic and unite it with its two counterparts, the Triforce of Power and the Triforce of Wisdom, in order to awaken a cursed Princess Zelda from an eternal slumber cast upon her an age before by an evil magician. After succeeding in lifting the "Binding Force" cast over the Valley of Death in the central section of Hyrule by restoring six crystals to their respective statues in six other palaces found across the land, Link is able to enter the palace in search of the final Triforce piece. Within the walls of the immense palace, Link is faced with his greatest challenges yet from some of the fiercest enemies he has encountered such as the very powerful guardian of the palace, the mighty Thunderbird, and shortly thereafter faces his own shadow to win possession of the Triforce of Courage from an old man that resides in the palace.

name: Kayra Mah Shrine
description: The Kayra Mah Shrine, also known as The Secret of The Hero and designated by the Trial name Greedy Hill, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Deception Castle
description: Deception Castle is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the second Level of the Sky Realm Area, preceded by Floating Garden and followed by Dragon Citadel.

name: Daqo Chisay Shrine
description: The Daqo Chisay Shrine, designated by the Trial name The Whole Picture, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Goma Asaagh Shrine
description: The Goma Asaagh Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Major Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Kamia Omuna Shrine
description: The Kamia Omuna Shrine, designated by the Trial name Moving Targets, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Kah Yah Shrine
description: The Kah Yah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Quick Thinking, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dancing Dragon Dungeon
description: Dancing Dragon Dungeon is the fourth dungeon in Oracle of Seasons. It is located near the summit of Mt. Cucco. Within this dungeon lies the fourth Essence of Nature, the Soothing Rain. To access the dungeon, Link requires the Power of Spring.

name: Future World
description: The Future World is the final dungeon in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Fossil Stallord Battle
description: Fossil Stallord Battle is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the third Stage in the Finale.

name: Ja Baij Shrine
description: The Ja Baij Shrine, designated by the Trial name Bomb Trial, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dagah Keek Shrine
description: The Dagah Keek Shrine, designated by the Trial name Dagah Keek's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Insect Cavern
description: Insect Cavern is the fourth dungeon in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. The structure is located on a mound located within the Gooey Swamp. The entrance is swarming with large bees, and it cannot be accessed until the Queen Bee offers to take Tingle to the top of the mound... for a price. The actual doorway will not open until Tingle has activated four switches located throughout the swamp. To do this, he must blast the stone-covered switches with a Tingle Bomb.

name: Finale
description: The Finale is a Level in Link's Crossbow Training.

name: City in the Sky
description: The City in the Sky is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is the seventh dungeon in Twilight Princess.

name: Cave of Ordeals
description: The Cave of Ordeals is an optional dungeon in Twilight Princess.

name: Ice Temple
description: Ice Temple is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the fourth Level in the Ice Cavern area.

name: Face Shrine
description: Face Shrine is the sixth Dungeon in Link's Awakening. It is the location of the Coral Triangle. The entrance, located in the Face Shrine region, is settled on a piece of land next to the cliffs separating it from the Rapids Ride. It is surrounded by some Armos, much like the area with the Southern Face Shrine, but to a lesser extent. The item hidden in this Dungeon is the L-2 Power Bracelet, while the mini-boss is a beast called Smasher. The Boss is Facade.

name: Ice Cavern
description: The Ice Cavern is a recurring location and Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Eastern Hyrule
description: Eastern Hyrule, also known as the Eastern Continent, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Ancient Cistern
description: The Ancient Cistern is a Dungeon in Skyward Sword.

name: Hila Rao Shrine
description: The Hila Rao Shrine, designated by the Trial name Drifting, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dungeon
description: Dungeons, also known as Levels, are locations in The Legend of Zelda series. They form the "underworld" of the worlds which Link visits and contain items and treasure to collect, enemies to overcome, and puzzles to solve.

name: Grim Temple
description: Grim Temple is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the fourth and last Level of The Ruins area.

name: Divine Beast Vah Rudania
description: Divine Beast Vah Rudania is a Divine Beast and a dungeon in Breath of the Wild. It is a giant machine that is in the shape of a lizard.

name: Deku Temple
description: The Deku Temple is the third Dungeon in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. It is found in the Deku Forest on the First Continent, and is actually the interior of the Deku Tree. Tingle ventures in to the temple to find the Life Dew, which will cure the Deku Tree's sapling. It requires 1500 Rupees to open the main gate. There are three Sub-Bosses, each found in their own rooms. This dungeon's main boss is Bana Bana, a three-headed carnivorous plants who is protecting the water that Tingle needs to obtain.

name: Gorae Torr Shrine
description: The Gorae Torr Shrine, designated by the Trial name Gorae Torr's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Gnarled Root Dungeon
description: Gnarled Root Dungeon is the first Dungeon in Oracle of Seasons. It is located in North Horon.

name: Death Mountain Foothills
description: Death Mountain Foothills is the first stage of Death Mountain in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Dark Palace
description: The Dark Palace is a dungeon in A Link Between Worlds. It is the Lorule counterpart of the Eastern Palace of Hyrule. Bombs are required to access it, and its boss is the Gemesaur King.

name: Ganon
description: Ganon, also known by his original/human form Ganondorf, is the main antagonist of The Legend of Zelda series. Ganon is a nickname for Ganondorf and the name given to him when he transforms into a boar-like beast. He made his debut appearance in the first game, The Legend of Zelda, and has since been present or referred to in most subsequent iterations.

name: Dako Tah Shrine
description: The Dako Tah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Electric Path, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Frozen Grotto
description: The Frozen Grotto is a dungeon in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Daag Chokah Shrine
description: The Daag Chokah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Daag Chokah's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fire Temple
description: The Fire Temple, also known as the Mountain Temple, is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Levels in
description: In Four Swords Adventures, Levels refers to chapters consisting of regional portions of Hyrule, which the Links travel to on their quest to save the Shrine Maidens and defeat Vaati. Each Level contains three Stages, which must be completed in order to progress through the Level. Upon the competion of the third Stage in a Level, a new Level and region of Hyrule is unlocked. There are a total of eight Levels in the game.

name: Chamber Dungeon
description: Chamber Dungeons are dungeons in Link's Awakening for Nintendo Switch.

name: Cave of Flames
description: The Cave of Flames, also known as the Mine, is the second Dungeon in The Minish Cap, located near the top of Mount Crenel. It used to be a human mine, but was abandoned at some point.

name: Eagle
description: Eagles are a recurring species in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Dragon Roost Cavern
description: Dragon Roost Cavern is the second Dungeon in The Wind Waker.

name: Ancient Castle of Ikana
description: The Ancient Castle of Ikana, also called Ikana Castle, is a mini-dungeon in Majora's Mask.

name: Divine Beast Vah Naboris
description: The Divine Beast Vah Naboris  is a Divine Beast and a dungeon in Breath of the Wild. It is a giant machine that loosely resembles a Bactrian camel. The two humps on its back generate electricity to strike lightning onto those who come near.

name: Den of Trials
description: The Den of Trials is a location in Tri Force Heroes. It is an area composed of several Zones released through the 2.0.0 update. Link is first told about the Den of Trials by The Great Tripini in Hytopia. He tells Link that a special Outfit, the Fierce Deity Armor, rests at the bottom of the Den of Trials.

name: Dark World
description: The Dark World, also known as the Evil Realm, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is a dimension parallel to the kingdom Hyrule, which is referred to as being a part the Light World in contrast, and a corrupted incarnation of the Sacred Realm. The Dark World debuted in A Link to the Past, making it the first of many realms alternate to Hyrule to appear in the series, the latter being Termina, the Twilight Realm, the World of the Ocean King, and Lorule.

name: Desert of Doubt (Stage)
description: The Desert of Doubt is the first stage of the eponymous level in Four Swords Adventures. The Gerudo tribe can be found in a village near the beginning of this stage. The village is in a bit of an uproar after Ganondorf, guardian of the Gerudo and the desert, left for the Pyramid against local laws. It is revealed that Ganondorf left in pursuit of power, and the Gerudo blocked the road to the desert to prevent others from doing so. In order to pass into the desert, the Links must ask permission from the leader of the tribe, who allows them to enter because of the crisis in Hyrule.

name: Daka Tuss Shrine
description: The Daka Tuss Shrine, designated by the Trial name Sunken Swoop, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Crown Dungeon
description: The Crown Dungeon is the fifth Dungeon in Oracle of Ages. It is located on Rolling Ridge in the present.

name: Chaas Qeta Shrine
description: The Chaas Qeta Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Major Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Cave of No Return
description: The Cave of No Return is the second stage of Whereabouts of the Wind in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Queen Ambi
description: Queen Ambi is a recurring character in The Legend of Zelda series.
